intro: Galatella punctata var. hyssopifolia, commonly known as the spotted bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is native to regions of Europe and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
